metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15466 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 3.2.0 to 3.2.4, the GVCP dissector could go into an infinite loop. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-gvcp.c by ensuring that an offset increases in all situations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15466` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 3.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libwireshark13 - 3.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libwiretap10 - 3.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libwsutil11 - 3.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
tshark - 3.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
wireshark - 3.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
wireshark-common - 3.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
wireshark-gtk - 3.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
wireshark-qt - 3.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
